intro: Dudleya congesta, commonly known as the dense Dudleya, is a succulent plant native to California and Baja California. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped growth pattern. The plant features thick, fleshy leaves that are typically blue-gray in color, covered in a fine layer of white powder. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink or white during the spring. Dudleya congesta is well adapted to rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal scrub habitats.
